sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces specializing in rare elements. Gd: Obtain from suppliers of rare earth elements. Na: Can be sourced from chemical supply companies. Sb: Available from chemical supply vendors. Sc: Purchase from specialty metal suppliers.
steps: Cs: Purchase from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces specializing in rare elements. Gd: Obtain from suppliers of rare earth elements. Na: Can be sourced from chemical supply companies. Sb: Available from chemical supply vendors. Sc: Purchase from specialty metal suppliers.

1. Weigh out each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean glass container, combine Cs and Gd thoroughly. 3. Gradually add Na while continuously stirring. 4. Slowly incorporate Sb and Sc into the mixture, ensuring uniformity throughout. 5. Mix until a consistent homogeneous mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean glass container, combine Cs and Gd thoroughly. 3. Gradually add Na while continuously stirring. 4. Slowly incorporate Sb and Sc into the mixture, ensuring uniformity throughout. 5. Mix until a consistent homogeneous mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 800 째C at a rate of 10 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and integration of components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 800 째C at a rate of 10 째C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and integration of components.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approx. 12 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking or structural weaknesses.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approx. 12 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking or structural weaknesses.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces and edges for finishing. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing compound to enhance durability if required. 4. Allow any sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surfaces and edges for finishing. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing compound to enhance durability if required. 4. Allow any sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
